title: The Problem in the Streets
bodyMd: Metro Manila faces recurring flood events that traditional watershed-scale maps fail to capture. **Street-level** assessment reveals vulnerability patterns invisible at broader scales.

title: Where Current Maps Fall Short
bodyMd: Barangay-level aggregation can hide micro-topographic traps. A single barangay can contain both high-ground safe zones and low-lying segments.

title: Street-Level Lens (Segments)
bodyMd: Each road segment is scored for flood proneness based on elevation, drainage condition, and canal proximity. Colors indicate **Low / Medium / High** risk.

title: What Drives Flood Risk
bodyMd: Risk combines multiple signals. The *Explainability* panel highlights **Top Contributors** and their weights for the selected segment.

title: Pilot Focus Areas
bodyMd: We prioritize corridors with repeated flood complaints and known drainage issues for field validation and maintenance planning.

title: What’s Next
bodyMd: Coming up: flood-aware routing, citizen feedback hooks, and integration with LGU planning workflows.
